perturbation.original_text: 6.2 Upon and subject to credit approval by Cisco, payment terms shall be [*****] days from shipping date. All payments shall be made in the currency in which the Price List is quoted for the applicable Purchase Order [*****].
perturbation.changed_text: 6.2 Upon and subject to credit approval by Cisco, payment terms shall be [*****] days from shipping date. Notwithstanding the foregoing, for all purchase orders exceeding $[*****], payment terms will be net 15 days from the invoice date. All payments shall be made in the currency in which the Price List is quoted for the applicable Purchase Order [*****].
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating that standard payment terms are [*****] days, but then specifies a different, shorter payment term of 15 days for larger orders. This creates uncertainty about which payment deadline should be enforced for orders exceeding $[*****].

perturbation.original_text: 12.0 INVENTORY BALANCE. For a [*****] period, beginning on the effective date of this agreement, Distributor has the option to return to Cisco, for credit, up to [*****] of the dollar value of Product listed on the Value Added Distributor Price List and shipped to Distributor in the preceding Cisco Quarter, net of credits issued by Cisco to Distributor. [*****] Cisco shall credit Distributor's account in the amount of the price paid by Distributor for returned Products, less any price protection credits issued to Distributor related to the Product returned (the "Return Credit"). Each of the following requirements must be met by Distributor:
perturbation.changed_text: 12.0 INVENTORY BALANCE. For a [*****] period, beginning on the effective date of this agreement, Distributor has the option to return to Cisco, for credit, up to [*****] of the dollar value of Product listed on the Value Added Distributor Price List and shipped to Distributor in the preceding Cisco Quarter, net of credits issued by Cisco to Distributor. However, the distributor can return up to 100% of inventory within the first 30 days of the contract. [*****] Cisco shall credit Distributor's account in the amount of the price paid by Distributor for returned Products, less any price protection credits issued to Distributor related to the Product returned (the "Return Credit"). Each of the following requirements must be met by Distributor:
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a contradiction in the inventory balance clause. It initially states that the distributor can only return a certain percentage ([*****]%) of the dollar value of products. However, the added sentence contradicts this by stating that the distributor can return up to 100% of the inventory within the first 30 days of the contract. This leads to confusion regarding the actual return policy and the limitations on returns.

perturbation.original_text: 13.3 Distributor must notify Cisco of the quantity of Obsolete Product to be returned to Cisco within [*****] of notification of obsolescence by Cisco. Such right to return is contingent upon return by Distributor of Obsolete Product within [*****] of such notification by Cisco. Such Product must be in new and unused condition and in factory sealed boxes.
perturbation.changed_text: 13.3 Distributor must notify Cisco of the quantity of Obsolete Product to be returned to Cisco within [*****] of notification of obsolescence by Cisco. Notwithstanding the prior sentence, Distributor has a full year from the date of obsolescence notification to return the products. Such right to return is contingent upon return by Distributor of Obsolete Product within [*****] of such notification by Cisco. Such Product must be in new and unused condition and in factory sealed boxes.
perturbation.explanation: This modification introduces a contradiction concerning the return timeframe for obsolete products. The initial sentence restricts the notification timeframe for obsolete product to be returned to Cisco within [*****]. However, the added sentence provides that Distributor has a full year to return the products. This conflict creates ambiguity regarding the actual return period.
